I've made a lot of KonMari jokes recently but I also spent 10y with someone without combining anything because I felt like I was on a knife edge. It's nice walking over to the "misc" box and putting my stuff in there. I spent 10 years terrified, separate, and now I'm combining 😊

I thought the GND movies were light dramas but they seem like they're two sock puppets arguing with each other. Has anyone else seen them? I'm interested to know more but I'm certain that watching them would just make me angry at how flimsy the arguments are
(I'm just kidding, Iolaus 4 lyfe)
Another commonality between my childhood play and the God's Not Dead movies is that both of them involved Kevin Sorbo
Basically, what my friends and I did with Barbies, except with talking instead of a) mashing their faces together to make them kiss or b) smashing their faces together to make them fight

I'm watching a series of YouTube videos about the God's Not Dead movies. (According to the videos I'm watching,) GND is a set of scripted dialogues about the existence of God, separation of church and state, etc.

I've watched 2-3 episodes of Marie Kondo's Netflix show and I keep thinking about how she greets every new space she meets.
I'm curious why she does it and whether there's a hidden purpose there as well.
@anghyflawn @JoFrhwld @WilsonMcLeod Oh makes sense! Thank you!

@ClementYChow It did! Not joyful enough I suppose to spark me clearing out the space where I would have hung them this Christmas. But now that spot is clear so maybe they will spread some early January cheer
@GavinNettlefold 😂
My porg stuffie is also sitting there because I don't know what to do with it

So even though I had a special box to collect all the Christmas decorations we had up, and even though I made a specific effort to go around collecting Christmas stuff to put in that box, those Christmas lights remained on that shelf like they were invisible
Our brains pay attention to changes, so if you've had a mess for a long time, that mess becomes normal and your brain no longer registers it

We have a "misc shelf" in our bedroom that accumulates all kinds of crap. I cleared most of it away, but I completely glossed over a box of Christmas lights that's been sitting there for 2 years. It's been there for so long, it became a part of the shelf, part of the background
I've been tidying but I haven't fully implemented the Konmari method; I don't dump everything into a giant pile and sort from there

The brain does some very counterproductive things when we're cleaning and organizing our spaces. Marie Kondo's tidying strategies seem absurd until you realize that they're meant to get around the weird stuff your brain does
